On the 6th of June 1944 a Reginald Trery Wiltshire landed on Juno Beach in the midst of what was later known as D-Day. He then went on to lead successful missions as a tank commander in world war two. Sixty two years later his grandson David Wiltshire founded a web design company in Nottingham. Having been inspired by his grandfather’s wartime past, he named this company Juno Web Design.

Over the years Juno has diversified its offering and services to clients using a strong mix of custom built web applications and open source software. When web designers create a website they tend to make several main versions of it and have to then make many more alterations before it is finally finished. The fact that websites are just digital pieces of information means that it's very cost effective to make big changes such as a different background colour; image trying to do these designer changes to a bricks and mortar shop! Clients generally tend to like to tweak websites created by designers which takes up a lot of man hours and sometimes a lot of stress. Whenever you create somebodies brand, consider these 'tweeks' in your pricing.

Web designing can seem like an easy job, all the designer has to do is move a mouse right? WRONG, it's a very skilled job and requires knowledge of user experience, branding and attention to detail. Graphical programs like Photoshop aren't beginner friendly and require at least half a year's training to use effectively. Look at obscure websites like ones for a local plumber or builder, you'll see a ghastly array of web designing attempts, many of which include comics sans or other graphical atrocities! The best way to design a site is to copy your favourite elements from many other sites, if you pick popular sites then these will have had many experts opinions on the design and will work well with conversion rates.

Web design for ecommerce is getting more and more complicated; even with the market becoming saturated and prices being driven down through competition, additional web development needs are again increasing costs. An ecommerce site now needs features that weren’t an issue a few years ago including on-site SEO, EPOS management, mobile phone versions and social media integrations to name a few! Ecommerce web design teams generally stick to old methods and use tried and testing web templates, which they can brand up. The cream of the crop such as Juno Web Design use bespoke systems for each client based on conversion rates, SEO and brand exposure.

If you’re looking to take the next step with your business, and want to begin selling and marketing your products online, the best thing you can do is to create a website. Designing and making a website can be a very tricky task, one which many people would struggle to do without the help of a good web design team. Often businesses work with a web design company when they’re looking to produce a new website, or simply update the branding on their existing websites. Web designers have the job of taking all of the clients wants and needs into consideration, before designing a site that looks appealing, but is also practical for potential customers to use. The cost of having a web designer produce a website for your business depends on many factors including: the type of website, how complex its design is and the length of time it takes to design it.
